subject: Home & DIY
title: Why Dryer Lint Is So Dangerous
description: A fast breakdown of Why Dryer Lint Is So Dangerous for builders.

hook.text: Dryer lint causes 2,900 house fires in the US every year. It's one of the most flammable materials in your home.

buildup.text: Lint is tiny loose fibers with enormous surface area relative to mass. More surface area means faster ignition.

discovery.text: When lint clogs the dryer vent, exhaust heat has nowhere to go. Temperatures climb past lint's ignition point of 210Â°C.

twist.text: Campers use dryer lint as a firestarter because it ignites instantly. That's the same stuff inside your walls.

climax.text: Cleaning the lint trap isn't enoughâ€”lint builds up inside the vent duct behind the dryer where you can't see it.

punchline.text: The best firestarter hides behind your dryer.

quiz.question: Why is dryer lint so flammable?
options: It has enormous surface area relative to its mass
It contains highly flammable chemical dyes
It generates static electricity that sparks
